thread.title: OPEC Price Fight Weighs on Oil

author: Neanda Salvaterra
title: OPEC Price Fight Weighs on Oil

organizations.name: opec price fight weighs on oil oil

text:
Oil prices fell Monday, weighed down by concerns about a rapid rise in U.S. crude output as cracks emerged in OPECâ€™s united front on output cuts.
Light, sweet crude for April delivery fell 68 cents, or 1.1%, to $61.36 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange. Brent, the global benchmark, declined 54 cents, or 0.8% to $64.95 a barrel.
